content:
Diagnosis:	Right lung base large cell carcinoma, T2bN2M1a

Management:	15 Jan 2024 - Started Carboplatin/Pemetrexed/Pembrolizumab
		12 Feb 2024 - Cycle 2 completed with good tolerance
		5 Mar 2024 - Cycle 3 completed, CT shows partial response

Histology:	Large cell carcinoma, PD-L1 80%, FGFR4 mutation positive

Current Situation:	MDT discussion post cycle 3 assessment

I am writing to document today's Lung MDT discussion for [redacted name]. The case was presented with recent imaging showing encouraging partial response to immunotherapy combination treatment. The CT thorax from 5/3/24 demonstrates 40% reduction in the right lower lobe primary mass (now measuring 4.2cm from 7.0cm) and significant improvement in pleural disease with resolution of pleural effusion. No new sites of disease were identified.

Performance status remains 1. Recent blood tests show stable renal function and liver function tests within normal range. The patient reports improved exercise tolerance and resolution of previous chest pain.

The MDT recommendations are to continue with the current treatment regimen of Carboplatin AUC5, Pemetrexed 500mg/m2 and Pembrolizumab 200mg for a further 3 cycles, followed by maintenance Pembrolizumab. A repeat CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis is recommended after cycle 6. [redacted name] will be reviewed in clinic next week prior to cycle 4, with routine blood tests and toxicity assessment.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows 40% reduction in right lower lobe primary mass (now 4.2cm from 7.0cm) and improvement in pleural disease with resolution of pleural effusion

patient_facts.value: Stable renal function and liver function tests within normal range
Improved exercise tolerance and resolution of previous chest pain

status_updates.value: Large cell lung cancer showing good partial response to immunotherapy combination. MDT recommends continuing current treatment plan.
40% reduction in primary tumor size and improvement in pleural disease
Continue with Carboplatin AUC5, Pemetrexed 500mg/m2 and Pembrolizumab 200mg for 3 more cycles, then maintenance Pembrolizumab
Clinic review next week prior to cycle 4 with blood tests and toxicity assessment
